reviewText: Yes, but it was very close to a no".\n\nI like this game
date: but it really is the base level for what I like. It's missing too much and feels like a rushed handheld port. For instance on the infinite levels one is still held to the artificially low building cap
recommended: so rather than see how far you can take a level you have to sit there with many open unbuilt spaces as the level runs to it's artificially quick end. I also really did not like the nontower puzzle levels at all
hoursPlayed: they felt forced and more like work than a game. I wish some more thought and effort had been put into Dead Stop. It feels like a demo for a larger game.\nThat said
voteText: it is a fun game and plays very well. The towers are pretty standard but in a good familiar way. Had the pricetag been three bucks I would be happierier recomending it.\nThe look of the game is great
helpfulPercent: the art director did a fantastic job."
commentsCount: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
